Title: Eating The HIGHEST CALORIE Last Meal Request EVER MADE By A Death Row Inmate!

In 2012, Gary Carl Simmons made history by requesting the highest calorie last meal ever by an inmate on death row before he met his demise. In this 24 hour food challenge, I'm attempting to make history myself by finishing every last calorie in this meal. It contained everything from pizza to insane amounts of ranch and cheese! 

Before each meal, I rolled 3 pairs of dice to determine the time limit for that meal. If I couldn't finish each meal within the time limit, then I had to eat a random last meal request made by another inmate in the next meal.

*Ingredient List* 
1. Bread (I used 70 calorie bread for this one, but you CAN find 40 calorie slices! Those are used in this recipe for macro purposes)

4. Raw Sugar 
5. Stevia 
6. Peanut Butter 
7. Powdered Sugar

My 600-lb Life is an American reality television series that has aired on the TLC television network since 2012. Each episode follows a year in the life of morbidly obese individuals, who usually begin the episode weighing at least 600 pounds (270 kg), and documents their attempts to reduce their weight to a healthy level. Update episodes, called "Where Are They Now?", feature one or more previous patients, picking up a year or more after their original episodes aired.

Patients are placed under the care of Iranian-American Houston surgeon Younan Nowzaradan (often referred to as simply "Dr. Now"), who first has them attempt losing weight on their own by following a strict diet, and then depending on the patient's progress may offer gastric bypass surgery or sleeve gastrectomy to further assist in weight loss.

Title: WHAT DO MY FULL BODY WORKOUTS LOOK LIKE? | NEW CAMERA
Description:
Just a sample “workout” that I’d do in the gym. Something simple that really only takes me 45 Minutes to an Hour. Here’s my typical routine down below! 


5-10 Minutes Mobility/Stretching 

Sumo Deadlifts (Or Conventional)
135lbs x 12 
185lbs x 8 
225lbs x 5 
275lbs x 5 
(working sets)
315lbs x 3
335lbs x 3 
345lbs x 3 (or top set at two or a single rep)

Squats (OR bench)
Bar x 12 
95lbs x 10
115lbs x 10

Title: Farrell's "Pigs Trough" 6 Scoop Sundae Qualifier! | ErikTheElectric
Description:
So today, I took on the "pigs trough challenge" in order to to qualify for the "pro division" for Farell's Ice Cream 6th annual eating contest which will be held in downtown Brea, CA on the 19th of July!


At the finals m, the two individual who has the fastest qualifying time will go head to head with the reigning champ.. Naader Reda and the two will have to eat a 7lb sundae in the fastest time possible. The winner WILL RECEIVE $750 and free ice cream for an entire year! 

The record for today's 6 scoop sundae was 1:35 (which is when Naader did it back in 2013). I completed my sundae today in 1 minute and 8 seconds! 6 scoops of chocolate, strawberry, and vanilla! All topped with whipped cream and hot fudge! 


Let's hope my time holds up so that I can eat some more ice cream!

Description:
**HUMMUS RECIPE**

Ingredients:
1 Can Rinsed Garbanzo Beans
Pinch of Garlic Salt
Pinch of Garlic Powder
Pepper 
1 Tablespoon Olive Oil 


1. Magic Bullet/Blender
2. Rinse/Drain your beans
3. Put beans in blender (with a touch of water)
4. Spices/Salt/etc 
5. Blend Blend Blend
6. ENJOY!

Title: I Tried To Eat 20,000+ Calories & BIKE 200 Miles in One Day!
Description:

DEFINITELY a very fun contest. I met a lot of awesome people and a lot of awesome subscribers! This was the amateur event, the pro one came after this one. As I said in the video, I’ll likely be up at that stage next year (assuming I can make the flight) however the event was full when I emailed about it, so I figured I’d attempt the qualifier and I won the trip to come out! 
The contest itself was a good one, the poutine was great! There was some debris through the various contestants as poutine is VERY messy (Gravy, Fries, and Cheese). But I made sure to clean up as much as I could (as you can see in the video).

Title: THE 100,000 CALORIE CHALLENGE!

Subscribe: http://bit.ly/2ATWtet  | IG: http://bit.ly/2rWyjgU
Watch the Fast Food Calorie Challenge: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XJv9Lujp0Qc

Hi Everyone! It is HERE! After years of doing INSANE eating challenges on YouTube, I decided to do the unthinkable. 100,000 CALORIES in 100 HOURS! Doughnuts, Nutella, Pizza, Peanut Butter, Chocolate... every food group makes an appearance in this video! 

Lots of questions will certainly be asked from this video. Meal Structuring, How much weight was gained, the cost of the entire challenge, etc. But that will all be addressed if the video get 50,000+ likes in the "aftermath video".

Also, to everyone that continuously throws the "Why is this so edited" comment out every time a calorie challenge is uploaded. Let me remind you, this was 100 HOURS of footage. There's no actual way to condense it down anymore than I did. If anyone needs any "proof" for my stomach capacity, you can check out the plethora of restaurant challenges and videos that I have on my channel and in my "restaurant challenges" playlist on my channel. 

Sit back and watch this epic challenge folks!

#ErikTheElectric #CalorieChallenge #SushiChallenge 
Hey Everyone! Thanks for checking out the video! I hope you all enjoy it. For this video, I ventured into my favorite sushi restaurant known as Deli Sushi and Desserts in San Diego, CA to order as much sushi as I could! 

There was a TON of rolls in the video, there rolls are generally pretty calorie dense with cream cheese, avocado, cheese and spicy mayo which made them the perfect fit for this video! (Out the full roll list down below) 

I hope you enjoy the video! 

Check out Deli Sushi and Desserts! ► http://Delisd.com 


Full Sushi Roll List! (Not in order eaten) ►
1. Spicy Tuna Roll (Tuna, Cucumber, Cream Cheese) 
2. Unagi Roll (Eel, Cucumber, Avocado & Cream Cheese) 
3. Crispy California roll (Shredded Crab, Cucumber, Avocado & Cream Cheese) 
4. Rainbow Roll (Salmon, Top: Assorted Fishes, Inside: Shredded Crab, Cucumber, & Avocado
5. Octoman Roll (Top: Tako with Massago, Green Onion & House Sweet & Spicy Sauce Inside: Spicy Tuna, Avocado, and Jalepeno
6 -7. Chubby Roll (Top: Massago (Smelt fish Eggs) with Eel Sauce, & our House Jalapeno Garlic Sauce Inside: Shredded Crab, Salmon, Avocado, Cream Cheese, & Crunchy Shrimp Chips)
8. Samurai Roll (Top: Albacore, Massago, & Green Onions w/ Spicy Ponzu Sauce Inside: Shredded Crab, Avocado, & Pickled Radish)
9. Ninja Roll (Ninja Roll Top: Albacore with Ponzu Sauce
Inside: Salmon, Cream Cheese, Avocado & Cucumber)
10. Dragon Roll (Top: Eel & Avocado with Eel Sauce
Inside: Shredded Crab, Cucumber, & Avocado)
11. Lion Roll (Top: Salmon, Tuna, & Avocado with Spicy Ponzu Sauce Inside: Spicy Tuna & Cucumber)
12. Caterpillar Roll (Top: Avocado with Eel Sauce Inside: Eel, Shredded Crab, & Cucumber)
13. Citrus Roll (Top: Yellowtail, Avocado, & Thin Lemon Slices Inside: Spicy Tuna, Cucumber, & Jalapeno)
14. Fire Roll (Top: Tuna & Slice Jalapeno with Sriracha Sauce
Inside: Spicy Tuna & Cucumber)
15. Philadelphia Roll (Salmon, Cream Cheese, & Avocado)
16. California roll (Shredded Crab, Cucumber, & Avocado)
17. Jamaican Roll (Top: Seared Salmon & Avocado with Spicy Mayo & Eel Sauce Inside: Shredded Crab, Eel, & Cream Cheese)
18. Miralani Roll (Top: Spicy Tuna with Eel Sauce
Inside: Shredded Crab, Cucumber, & Avocado)
19. Unagi Roll (Eel, Cucumber, & Avocado with Eel Sauce)
20. Spicy Tuna (Tuna, Cucumber, Cream Cheese)

Hey Everyone! Welcome back to another video and another CALORIE CHALLENGE! Quite recently, I reached a milestone on this channel.. I reached 1 million subscribers! You’ve all been requesting another epic calorie challenge so I’m very excited to bring you another one! 

In this challenge, I decided to take on an UNLIMITED amount of calories in 48 hours.. with a twist. After every 1,000 calories that I eat, I decided to give $10 to St. Jude Research Hospital. I encourage all of you to do so as well, as of the time of filming for this, it will be ending on the 26th of October, 2019 because I cannot extend the charity duration any longer, but until then… feel free to check out the link! 

That being said, I hope you all enjoy this epic challenge! I did my best to keep this video under an hour (less talking, faster eating) so I hope you all like this one. Be sure to like, comment and SUBSCRIBE! Thank you all for the support and loyalty over the past six years! Here’s to more challenges to come!

Description:
As the new year approaches, I'm starting to reflect on the direction(s) I've taken my channel. Don't get me wrong, this year has been absolutely INSANE in so many different ways. But the last thing I want this channel to be primarily about is "eating challenges". Eating is a passion of mine, but it's only one thing about me. I do want to "appeal" to many other people, that aren't just fans of eating challenges and watching a guy take down 30,000 calories in a day. Just a "FAQ" for those that may be slightly confused or that may have questions after viewing the video!

There were some slight calculation errors in the video. Unfortunately, I forgot to delete the "chocolate shakes" from the MFP entry used in the video, however I forgot to account for the coconut oil used while baking the reese's bars and also the additional milk I used with the final meal. Thankfully, when it was all said and done I was over 40,000 calories! 

This one was INSANE! Definitely the biggest day of eating I've EVER had. Enjoy!

1 Box Cinnamon Toast Crunch

About Erik TheElectric:

I'm Erik. I'm more than just a face on your computer screen, stuffing stupid amounts of food in his mouth. I'm a cyclist, powerlifter and fitness lover and am an individual with a passion for LIVING life to the fullest, in every way possible. I've battled hardships in life, as well have, and I love connecting with those of you who have battled just as much as I have. This channel is primarily based around food challenges, reviews, and how AWESOME food it is. But it's also a channel in which I get to share with you, my life. Through a camera lens. Quite recently, I started my own separate podcast channel (which is also on iTunes) which you can find down below. Thanks for the support and for the encouragement!

Title: THE 60,000 CALORIE CHALLENGE
Description:
(Check me out on social media!) 
► Instagram: http://bit.ly/2rWyjgU
► Facebook: http://bit.ly/2sXVR3t
► Twitter: http://bit.ly/2soQEog
► Snapchat: @ErikTheElectric 
► Strava: Erik”TheElectric”Lamkin
► GamerTag: ErikTheElectric

I never thought I'd attempt anything this dumb, but one year after the infamous "50,000 calorie challenge" I thought I'd take things up a "notch" by attempting to surpass my old 50,000 calorie video. 

**As a formal disclaimer**
I DO NOT (as it should be obviously inferred) recommend doing this for ANYONE. I'm a competitive eater and have built a relatively larger (than normal) stomach capacity to be able to tolerate large amounts of food. If an average person were to attempt something of this nature, negative consequences could come of it, for that reason I will say that you should DEFINITELY not try to do anything of this nature. 

All of the MyFitnessPal Screen shots are entirely accurate, if you want to tell me that they (or my meals) are "fake" (which are just the usual troll comments), then by all means feel free. But before you do so, please check out the numerous restaurant challenges and eating contests that I've posted on my channel. 

The video was long enough already, before I did my final edit, I had just over 1.5 hours of "Finalized" footage, therefore I needed to make even more cuts. So again, if you'd like to call anyone out for being "fake", take that into consideration. 

I did overshoot the "last meal" by a large amount, I thought I'd end with my "favorites", and well.. (I won't spoil it, heh). Also, keep in mind that when you take in calories/food/carbs of this caliber, you lose part of your mental coherency, hence why I (found it rather hilarious really) kept saying "not bad" so much. So excuse that (and the messiness during the video). And I am aware I missed one "not bad" around the middle of the video, lol.

I ended up baking my breakfast bread the night before, as referenced in the video, here's the ingredients:
- 4 Cups of Flour 
- 2 Whole Eggs 
- 100g Butter 
- 5 Tablespoons of Sugar 
- 1 Tsp Yeast

Title: Homemade Calzone | Puffin Limited Edition Review | Front Squat PRs
Description:
**RECIPE**
- 1 Cup WW Flour 
- 1 Cup White Flour
- 1 Pack Fast Rising Yeast
- Pinch of Sugar
- Garlic Salt 
- 1/4 Cup Warm water (depending on consistency) 
- Garlic Powder
- Mrs Dash
- Cheese 
- Pizza Sauce 

1. Start by heating up your water and preheating the oven to 425 degrees.
2. Next, put your flour in a bowl with yeast and dry ingredients. 
3. Add in water and mix with spatula/mixer
4. Mix throughly and cover with plastic wrap for 10-15 minutes
5. After 15 minutes pop onto a pizza dish and cover with pizza sauce and cheese (soy ftw) and put in the oven at 425 for 15 minutes
6. ENJOY!

Title: MY FIRST "FULL DAY OF EATING"
Description:
**GET AN ERIKTHEELECTRIC SHIRT HERE!**
http://eriktheelectric.bigcartel.com/

**RECIPES USED!*

COCONUT GARLIC SHRIMP PASTA

SAUCE
5-6 sauteed garlic cloves 
1/2 Cup Coconut Milk
1 tsp Kosher Salt 

PASTA
2 Cups Pasta (any Kind) 
Tomatoes (Diced) 

Simply make the pasta like normal, add in diced tomato and set aside.
For the sauce, sauté the garlic cloves, put in food processor with coconut milk with kosher salt and process. 

Add in the sauce with the pasta and enjoy! 


PROTEIN GRANOLA! 

2 Cups Raw Oats 
1 Tablespoon Coconut Oil
3-4 Tablespoons Baking Coco 
1 Scoop Cellucor Whey 
Cinnamon 
Vanilla Extract (Optional)
1/4-1/2 Cup Coconut Sugar 

For the entire recipe, check out the video!

Title: THE "ALL CARB WEEK" | FINDING MYSELF | BURGER RECOVERY
Description:
I just want to say THANK YOU to everyone that has supported the channel over the years, I've been doing a large amount of self-reflection lately and I've met so many individuals that truly have made an impact on my life throughout my time on YouTube. I realize that the footage towards the end of the video may not make a lot of sense to those who are new to my channel, for context as to what I was going through during those times. My story is down below. I have a large amount of thinking and planning to do, in regards to my future and my well-being. But I'm confident that the direction I'm going is the right one! About Erik TheElectric:

I'm Erik. I'm more than just a face on your computer screen, stuffing stupid amounts of food in his mouth. I'm a cyclist, powerlifter and fitness lover and am an individual with a passion for LIVING life to the fullest, in every way possible. I've battled hardships in life, as well have, and I love connecting with those of you who have battled just as much as I have. This channel is primarily based around food challenges, reviews, and how AWESOME food it is. But it's also a channel in which I get to share with you, my life. Through a camera lens. Quite recently, I started my own separate podcast channel (which is also on iTunes) which you can find down below. Thanks for the support and for the encouragement!

Title: THE TACO BELL NAKED CHICKEN CHIP BURGER | 10,000+ CALORIES
Description:
(Check me out on social media!)

*As always, let me know what you guys think of the video and the NEW SERIES! Be sure to leave those comments and suggestions down below!*

Support The Channel on Patreon! ► 
https://www.patreon.com/ErikTheElectric

**ONLINE COACHING AND APPAREL**  ►
http://eriktheelectric.bigcartel.com/product/8-week-nutrition-plan

I wanted to combine my love of fast food reviews AND food challenges into one series and call it "Electric Eats!". The naked chicken chips from taco bell have been getting lots of buzz lately, so I decided to try them out! Of course, I like to pull my usual shenanigans in the drive thru and have fun with the drive thru workers, if you don't like making people smile every day, that's totally cool, but I prefer to not be a grumpy human being all the time!

As far as the REVIEW goes, keep in mind that it IS still a food "review" technically. It's quite common for those who are fixated on watching strictly food challenges stumble upon food reviews, scratch their heads, get angry, and then yell at the computer screen (usually in the form of a comment) stating "STOP COMPLAINING!". I then have to respond with the above statement. 

This "challenge" clocked in at just over 10,000 calories with the buns, LOTS of extra cheese, 24 chicken "chips", 70/30 patties (350 calories per patty, an entire bag of fries, and of course a salad with dressing!

Title: THE ULTIMATE DOMINO'S "PIZZA-BURGER" | 11,000 CALORIES
Description:

ErikTalks on ITUNES! ►
https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/eriktalks/id1194915765?mt=2

**What an INSANE challenge this was!**
I'm not used to taking in this much red meat in one sitting, I definitely learned a lot from this one. As I stated in the video I ALWAYS wanted to make my very own "pizza burger", and I'm stoked with the final product! Here's the ingredients that were used.

- 1 Double Pepperoni Medium Domino's Pizza (2,205 calories)
- 1 Mushroom Pepperoni Medium Domino's Pizza (1,800 Calories)
- 4 lbs of Ground Beef (3,800 calories)
- 2  Entire Packets of Cheddar Cheese (1,700 Calories)
- 1 Bag of Frozen Onion Rings (1,100 Calories) 
- Tomatoes (~40 Calories)
- Salad + Dressing (~200 Calories)

I was bit let down because Domino's advertised that they were doing a special discount for college graduates until the 28th, in which you'd be able to get two large 1 topping pizza's for $5.99 each, but apparently it wasn't so. But I still had a good time with this challenge nonetheless!

WHAT A CHALLENGE! 

Know since I made sure to state in the video (despite the fact that I’ll get asked a bunch of times, which is perfectly alright) I wanted to “rate” all of these sweets for those wondering what my thoughts were on them! This challenge was DEFINITELY the hardest “candy” challenge that I’ve ever done, seeing as I’ve done a full “german themed” one in the past and a few others. This challenge clocked in at around 17,800 calories! A special thanks to “Lucie” from across the pond in the United Kingdom for taking the time to send all of these to me!

About Erik TheElectric:

I'm Erik. I'm more than just a face on your computer screen, stuffing stupid amounts of food in his mouth. I'm a cyclist, powerlifter and fitness lover and am an individual with a passion for LIVING life to the fullest, in every way possible. I've battled hardships in life, as well have, and I love connecting with those of you who have battled just as much as I have. This channel is primarily based around food challenges, reviews, and how AWESOME food it is. But it's also a channel in which I get to share with you, my life. Through a camera lens. Quite recently, I started my own separate podcast channel (which is also on iTunes) which you can find down below. Thanks for the support and for the encouragement!

Title: THE McDONALD'S McMOUNTAIN CHALLENGE (World Record Attempt)
Description:
(Check me out on social media!) 
► Instagram: http://bit.ly/2rWyjgU
► Facebook: http://bit.ly/2sXVR3t
► Twitter: http://bit.ly/2soQEog
► Snapchat: @ErikTheElectric 
► Strava: Erik”TheElectric”Lamkin
► GamerTag: ErikTheElectric

**ENOUGH ABOUT THE CLOCK COMMENTS!**
As is evidenced in my numerous live streams and vlogs, my clock on the wall in the back has been broken for the past 6 months. Up until a few days after this challenge was filmed, did I take it down. If you do not "believe" any of what is seen in this video, feel free to check out my numerous restaurant challenges and contest videos! 

This challenge was by far my biggest and most difficult EVER. I underestimated how much bread and starch would be involved in this challenge. But thankfully, I handle starches/carbs extremely well, and the music seemed to help! I have some BIG stuff coming up this summer and the next part of the year, so increasing my capacity is definitely on the game plan! 

Here’s what the “McMOUNTAIN” Consisted of..

80 Chicken MgNuggets 
2 Egg McMuffins
2 Sausage McMuffins (Cheese)
10 Hashbrowns
4 Large Fries 
4 Bacon McDoubles 
2 Filet O’ Fishes 
2 Normal Cheeseburgers
2 Fried Apple Pies 
8 Slices Cheddar Cheese
4 Ranch Packets
4 BBQ Packets
4 S&S Packets
Ketchup 
8 Pack of Hamburger Buns
8 Pack Potato Buns 
1 Bottle of Ranch

Title: The "Cereal De Mayo" Challenge | 9,000 CALORIES
Description:
**Don't forget to hit that like/subscribe button for more challenges!**


(Also, feel free to follow my social media!)



Facebook: www.facebook.com/erikjameslamkin
Twitter: www.twitter.com/ErikTheElectric
Instagram: ErikTheElectric




By far one of my most enjoyable challenges. I've been eating cereal since I popped out of the womb. I would literally down a box every morning for breakfast as a kid.. I've always laughed when people suggest serving sizes for cereal and have always said to myself "who in their right mind eats ONE SERVING" of cereal?". 


With this challenge, I wanted to go back to my childhood. Obviously, MANY of my old childhood favorite cereals have been discontinued (Oreo-Os, honey nut clusters, etc). But I picked ones that I enjoyed as a kid and still do! This challenge came in at 

~ 9 THOUSAND calories 
~ 1675 Grams of Carbohydrates
~ 145 Grams of Fat
~ 226 Grams of Protein 


The crazy amount of lactose got to me (as it always does in challenges that have milk, mainly because I NEVER drink milk and don’t do well with it). I thought about doing the challenge with almond milk, but it wouldn’t have been as “authentic” in my opinion. 


Like I said, pretty fun and enjoyable. My last challenge was almost a month ago so I wanted to get back into the swing of things.


STAY TUNED FOR THE NEXT ONE!

"Electric Cabello" - Kevin Macleod 
"Unity" - Kevin Macleod

About Erik TheElectric:

I'm Erik. I'm more than just a face on your computer screen, stuffing stupid amounts of food in his mouth. I'm a cyclist, powerlifter and fitness lover and am an individual with a passion for LIVING life to the fullest, in every way possible. I've battled hardships in life, as well have, and I love connecting with those of you who have battled just as much as I have. This channel is primarily based around food challenges, reviews, and how AWESOME food it is. But it's also a channel in which I get to share with you, my life. Through a camera lens. Quite recently, I started my own separate podcast channel (which is also on iTunes) which you can find down below. Thanks for the support and for the encouragement!

Title: THE KOBE BRYANT DIET CHALLENGE! (FOOD CHALLENGE TRIBUTE)
Description:
“THE KOBE BRYANT DIET CHALLENGE! (FOOD CHALLENGE TRIBUTE)"
Subscribe HERE: https://www.youtube.com/c/ErikTheElectric?sub_confirmation=1 
Don't forget to hit that notification bell, so YOU don't miss an upload! 




#KobeBryant #DietChallenge #BlackMamba 
Hey Everyone, welcome back to another video and another diet challenge. I wanted to take this week to dedicate a video to Kobe Bryant who wasn’t just a famous basketball player to me, he was an amazing and inspiring person to millions of people across the globe. 


There wasn't a lot of information on the internet about Kobe's diet. But I did come across a few articles from the nutritionists for the Los Angeles Lakers which I was able to develop into what a typical diet for Kobe, would look like! Here's a breakdown:


- 32oz Grass-fed Beef
- 12 Free Range Eggs 
- 1 Container of Oats (with Blue Agave) 
- 4 Cups Chocolate Almond Milk Pudding 
- 1 Spinach Salad 
- 16oz Kombucha 
- 1 Bottle Green Tea 
- 32oz Powerade Zero Sugar 
- Grass-fed "Organic" Milk 
- Cheese & Meat Board 
- 3 Organic Apples 
- 1 Container of Hummus 
- 1 Container Mixed Nuts 


If you enjoyed the video, please let me know down in the comments below!

I decided to come off of my ADHD medication completely for now, I know I will have a lot wondering why I chose to come off of it AND coffee/stimulants entirely. Right now, time is everything. I figured the sooner the better, the sooner I began to get my body adapted nothing but FOOD and SLEEP the better. That is ideally how the human body should function, and most likely the reason why I'm feeling the way that I am. 

I also know that a lot will question me, and also tell me that I "seem down" or seem "unhappy". But that is entirely what happens in scenarios like this. I will say that I will NOT hide who I am, or how I'm feeling and put on a "front" for people, simply because my camera is out. I'm not fake, and never will be. This is who I am.. those who support me and who want the best for me, will realize this. Thanks all.

Title: ErikTheElectric takes on Oink and Moo's "Triple Headed Monster" Burger Challenge!
Description:
The "Triple Headed Monster Burger Challenge" 
(Now called the "LAMKINATOR")

I had 47.5 minutes to finish the Goliath burger. Only ONE person has ever finished the burger in the entire history or the restaurant. Even Jamie "The Bear" McDonald was unable to take the best down when he came into the restaurant a while back! (If you look closely on The Wall of Shame, you can see his picture). If I finished the burger, I received it FREE OF CHARGE, eternal glory, I got to name the burger after myself, AND I got my name up on the wall of fame! I ALSO got to add in "my layer" of whatever I wanted for the next challenger to try and defeat! 

The burger came out and I was blown away...
- 4 sets of buns 
- 8 patties (4 habanero patties.. SO spicy) 
- 1 whole pulled pork sandwich
- 1 Mac and cheese fritter on top 
- 5 fried eggs 
- Onion Rings 
- mountain of lettuce/tomato/onion 
- 2 pickles 
- 12 slices of bacon 
- 12 slices of cheese 
- One whole Kielbasa Sausage 
- 21 oz soft drink (must be finished) 
- 2 POUNDS of waffle fries 
(Well over 7 pounds of food) 





This was easily my most difficult challenge, but definitely delicious and worth it! The previous winner "Arturo" designed the burger to be "unbeatable" with the habanero patties AND the pulled pork sandwich at the top. As soon as the burger came out and I started, I made sure to work my way down and get the burger down FIRST. THIS WAS MY FIRST EVER CHALLENGE WITH SODA! (I chose sprite) to my surprise, it actually helped me quite a bit! I talked to a friend of mine before hand (Randy Santell) and the restaurant is notorious for adding MORE to the burger than what is listed, again.. I was surprised to find 2 additional sets of buns, more fries and more vegetables than what I saw in the previous pictures. But, I just kept eating!


I made sure to pace myself and keep working the burger until I finished it. Once the meat and vegetables were done, it was time for the bread (which I dipped in ranch). After that was painfully over, all that was left was the fries! These were absolutely disgusting, cold and soggy. I was able to power through them and finish at 41 minutes and become the NEW RECORD HOLDER FOR THE BURGER! I chose to "leave my mark" for the next challenger by choosing to put a HALF CHICKEN ontop of the burger for the next person who attempts to take down the beast! 

IT IS NOW NAMED AFTER ME! 
I was going to go with the "electrifyer", but chose "The LAMKINATOR" instead! (My last name fit better) 
I got my money back, got DESSERT, and my name up on the wall of fame! 
Again, this was easily the most difficult challenge I've ever done. But I can finally say, after doing this.. And talking with the designer of the burger, I WILL be looking into the MLE and will be doing a pro eating qualifier soon! 


I CANT WAIT!

Title: The AYCE SUSHI CHALLENGE | 12,000+ Calories!
Description:
DEFINITELY one of my tastiest challenges yet! (And with a $25 price tag for over $200 worth of sushi? I'm game!) Check out the video to see how I did! 

I do just want to say that I HATE Avocado (and Jalapenos). While every roll seemed to be loaded with both of them, I felt like the extremely large amounts of mayonnaise and cream cheese in most of the rolls masked the flavor of it, so I was able to handle it. It was more of the texture of the Avocado that started getting to me. The rolls were absolutely DELICIOUS, but after roll 15.. I started to feel the food wall. (Mainly because waiting over 20+ minutes for re-orders while the massive amounts of starch sat in my stomach really got to me as well). I'd estimate I took down between 9-10 lbs of sushi, and again... likely over $200 worth! So I ain't even mad!

Title: THE WORLDS LARGEST PIZOOKIE CHALLENGE! (20,000+ CALORIES)
Description:
“THE WORLDS LARGEST PIZOOKIE CHALLENGE! (20,000+ CALORIES)“
Subscribe: http://bit.ly/2ATWtet  | IG: http://bit.ly/2rWyjgU
Watch the Fast Food Calorie Challenge: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XJv9Lujp0Qc

Hi Everyone! In this challenge, I decided to construct the worlds LARGEST PIZOOKIE! A pizookie is a sweet dessert that we have here in America, and it's typically served at a place called "BJs". It's always something that's on the smaller side, so I wanted to make a COLOSSAL ONE! A pizookie is a cookie pizza essentially, and it's served with a scoop of ice cream on top! (In this case 4 pints of ice cream)

I made sure to use some reeses cups, kit kats, and snickers in the cookie dough mixture as well. Had a lot of fun making this one! Be sure to check out the video to see how I did!

Title: $1300 "LUCKY SEVEN CHICKEN CHALLENGE" | ErikTheElectric
Description:
**CHALLENGE STARTS AROUND 4:05**

The "Lucky Seven Challenge" at China Blue in Corvallis, Oregon!

ONE HOUR.
7 POUNDS.
7 TYPES OF CHICKEN.
$1,300 JACKPOT.

What a hell of a challenge this was! Just a little bit of a backstory. This challenge features a progressive JACKPOT that increases every single month by $100 every time that it's not completed. This jackpot was won last year by Stephanie Wu who took home $1,500. I was a day away from booking a flight last year before I was informed that the challenge had been completed. Very discouraged, that being said.. When I was informed of the jackpot recently I vowed to take on the challenge. I headed out after class late on Wednesday night and took the 16 hour drive and the rest is history.


The challenge features SEVEN pounds of SEVEN different kinds of chicken.
Here they are, listed in order of the best tasting (in my opinion)

1. Hazelnut - 9/10 (Middle bowl)
2. Mandarin - 8/10
3. Sweet and Sour - 8/10
4. Orange - 7/10
5. General Taos- 7/10
6. Hunan - 5/10
7. Lemon - 3/10


Like I said, I went into this challenge extremely tired, fatigued and without much hunger as I drove 15 hours straight to get up to the restaurant. The chicken came out PIPING HOT. I used ice cubes and a separate plate to cool them down. The breading on the chicken was extra thick and I'd estimate the chicken weighed almost EIGHT pounds (instead of the listed 7 pounds). Since I do not consume meat, I was very nervous about taking down this colossal amount in one sitting. I finished the challenge around the 35 minute mark and took home the $1,300 check and got my picture on the wall!

WELL! This challenge definitely wasn't my biggest challenge ever, but I still had some fun with it! "Electric Eats" recipes aren't ever really gigantic calorie packed food challenges, they're fun to test my "culinary skills" and to combine my love of eating lots of food into one! 

As far as the recipe for the pizza "crust" since I'll get asked a lot. I used this recipe from "Thrillest" and tailored it... up a notch. 
https://www.thrillist.com/videos/eat/nation/fried-chicken-crust-pizza-recipe

As far as the ingredients used:
- 3.5 lbs of Chicken 
- 6 Containers of Mashed Potatoes 
- Gravy 
- 3/4 Cup of Butter 
- 1 Container of Cheese 
- 8oz Vegetable Oil (for frying) 
- 1 Container of Pepperoni 
- 2 Containers of shake and bake mix 
- 2 Large Eggs 
- 3 Cups of Flour


Let me know how you guys like these and I can make more of them!

Title: THE 20,000 CALORIE FRUIT AND VEGGIE CHALLENGE!
Description:
Support The Channel on Patreon! ► 
https://www.patreon.com/ErikTheElectric

**ONLINE COACHING AND APPAREL**  ►
http://eriktheelectric.bigcartel.com/product/8-week-nutrition-plan

BOOM! 

Without a doubt, my most DIFFICULT challenge that I’ve ever done. I was challenged by Vegan YouTuber John Venus to do the "10,000 Calorie Fruit Challenge". So, I decided to embark upon the challenge with my own little "spin" to it! I figured there are going to be LOADS of misconceptions and of course assumptions about the particular challenge that you saw above, so a few key points.

1. Everything came from (predominately) whole food, fruits and vegetables. The "no juice rule" stayed in place, and there's a VAST difference when consuming straight juice (with little to zero satiation value) vs a DENSE and THICK shake/smoothie, which can serve as a meal replacement (in this case a few meals for some people). 
2. "But Erik! Coconuts aren't FRUITS they're NUTS!" (Please see here: http://www.thebestofrawfood.com/is-coconut-a-fruit.html)
3. "But you used coconut sugar and coconut oil?" Yes! However, this made up for around ~4-5% of overall calorie consumption. 
4. This was again, the HARDEST challenge I've ever done. Even with my 13-14lb stomach capacity, the recovery from this challenge was the hardest. You'll be seeing more of that in the vlogs to come!

Man that was rough..

Really was stoked to do my FIRST EVER food challenge at home! I was originally going to try/attempt to topple matt stonies current Chicken Mg nugget record (120). But I really thought about it, and figured I wouldn’t really enjoy that sort of challenge.. what’s one thing I’ve really always loved? PIE! And it made perfect sense, because I have my first ever MLE competition coming up in just over a week! And what better time to practice then today? 

I ended up picking up two claim jumper pies (not the best), one store bout pumpkin pie, and one entire family sized pack of chicken pot pies. ALL OF THESE PIES COMBINED WEIGHED JUST OVER 8.5 POUNDS. That’s over 10,500 calories, 595g Fat, 1,152g carbs, 170g protein (lol), and 10,500mg of sodium. Pretty nuts! The amount of sugar in the peanut butter pie was so painful, peanut butter is by far one of my favorite things in this entire world to eat. But each spoonful was an overload, it was gnarly. 

I would say that the best part about this challenge was the dutch apple pie with the crumble topping. It was a pain to have to thaw everything out and then bake it, but I got it plated up and going when I could! I started feeling the pain about 15 minutes in, and that’s when the sugar rush started hitting me. My biggest mistake was saving the peanut butter pie for LAST instead of tackling it first. It was undoubtedly the most dense and most rich pie. 

This was tough, but VERY good training. I was able to get everything down in 64 minutes (just over an hour). NOW it’s time for next week!

Title: Cellucor Cor Fetti High Protein Cheesecake
Description:
Perfect, macro-friendly alternative for real cheesecake. And it's right around the holidays!

Ingredients: 
4oz Fat Free Cream Cheese
6g Stevia
1.5 Servings Sugar Free Jello
½ Scoop Cellucor Whey (Cor Fetti)
1 Cup Fat Free Greek Yogurt 
1 Cup Pumpkin
1 egg (or ½ Cup Liquid Egg Whites)
Dash of Cinnamon
1 tsp Vanilla Extract

Directions: 
Start by preheating your oven to 350 degrees.
Next, spray down your cooking dish with non stick cooking spray.

Take 4oz of Cream Cheese, 6g of stevia, and your egg (or egg whites) and beat them in a mixing bowl. Next, add in your pumpkin, greek yogurt, Cellucor Whey, Sugar Free jello, cinnamon, and other flavorings and whisk until you get the "cheesecake batter". 

Put into the dish and bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes, and ENJOY!

Serve with Ice Cream, additional yogurt, or top with syrup/peanut butter!

*Let cool overnight for a better tasting cheesecake*

Macros (Whole Cheesecake) (without toppings):
417 kcals 38 Carbohydrates 2 Fat 62 Protein 1 1,17
 Sodium

#ErikTheElectric #Zellagabetsky #CalorieChallenge
Hi Everyone! Welcome back to ANOTHER challenge! This is stop #6 on the Electric Tour and we're at Kenny & Ziggy's in Houston, Texas! 
They have a MASSIVE sandwich known as "The Zellagabetsky" which is the biggest deli sandwich I've ever seen! It consists of about 6lbs of meat, 2lbs of bread, 2lbs of cheese and all of the additional fixings (Mayo, Coleslaw, and more sauce).

Title: ErikTheElectric vs The B.O.B (12.5lbs of Food)
Description:
Check out Island Soul Bistro here!

http://www.island-soul-bistro.com


**FOLLOW ME FOR MORE CHALLENGES!**

IG: ErikTheElectric
FB: www.facebook.com/erikjameslamkin
Twitter: ErikTheElectric








WITHOUT A DOUBT
My biggest and hardest challenge yet. Last night, I attempted to take down the “B.O.B” platter at “Island Soul Bistro” in Lemon Grove, CA. This was their first EVER food challenge, so I was VERY excited to take this thing on. And then I went into the back kitchen and saw it being plated/made.. This thing was TWELVE and a half pounds of straight up soul food! An entire family sized platter called the “Best of Both Worlds” platter, red velvet chicken and waffles, and peach cobbler to top it all off! 

Before I say anything else, I just want to mention how friendly and awesome the ENTIRE staff was and how awesome it was to get the CRAZY amount of support that I had with the challenge. At least FIFTY people came out just to see the challenge take place at the restaurant and it was without a doubt my favorite challenge!

I started off with the protein (obviously) and worked my way through the ribs. They were tough, but I got through them. Each bone felt like it was a mini baseball bat, but I got through them in around 4-5 minutes. After that I worked through the chicken (very tough) and fish and then started with the sides. Each side felt like PURE death as everything was a heavy.. and I mean HEAVY starch.“Potatoes.. Rice.. Greens.. Beans.. Mac and Cheese, and then a few pounds of battered chicken and waffles after that?” I questioned myself as I finished the meats, I didn’t know if I really had it in me. After all of my challenges, this was the only time I where I really questioned it and my ability. But then the infamous “Second wind” hit me, and I powered through the collard greens, beans, chicken and rice (my favorite), mac and cheese, pickled dish, and then the potatoes to finish it off. The red velvet chicken and waffles (by this point) were EXTREMELY tough to get down and each waffle was like a brick in my stomach. The chicken was tough, the waffles were dry (since they had been out for that period of time, but STILL delicious). But I kept going and going regardless of the signals my stomach was sending to me. Finally I got all of them down...

”Oh, you thought it was over?
The head chef brought out my “dessert” to top it all off.. Peach Cobbler. And I shook my head in awe as I looked at it being set down on the table. Oddly enough this was one of my favorite parts of the entire meal! It was smooth, creamy and delicious! 
As I shoveled the last bite of ice cream into my mouth, I FINISHED THE 12.4 POUNDS OF FOOD IN 35 MINUTES! Setting the mark as the FIRST EVER PERSON TO EVER ACCOMPLISH IT! So stoked, but so painful. After completing this challenge, this solidified (to me) that I need to really start taking my challenges to the next level.. 

EXPECT SOMETHING BIG IN THE NEAR FUTURE!



Music - FreeStockMusic.com

Title: The 50 Banana & Peanut Butter VEGAN CHALLENGE!
Description:
Without a DOUBT my most difficult (and most "healthy")  challenge yet. I can honestly say that I'll NEVER eat a Banana, ever again after this one. As you'll see in the video, my scale has a 12 POUND capacity. So the fact that it couldn't even weigh the bananas must say something, I'd estimate this to be around 13-14lbs! 

Thanks for watching and be sure to subscribe if you haven't already!

Title: The 8 POUND Electric Sundae Challenge | ErikTheElectric vs. The Storm
Description:
**Don't forget to hit that like/subscribe button for more challenges!**

(CHECK OUT THE STORMS CHANNEL!)

https://www.youtube.com/user/stormfury89


(Also, feel free to follow my social media!)



Facebook: www.facebook.com/erikjameslamkin
Twitter: www.twitter.com/ErikTheElectric
Instagram: ErikTheElectric


**Music Credit**


(All Credit goes to Kevin Macleod!)
"Hitman"
"Oppressive Gloom"
"Unity"





Well this was certainly my “coldest” challenge yet. I received a message a little over a week ago from “The Storm” on YouTube inquiring about doing a “challenge” together. It was simple and straight forward. To create the most epic sundae/banana split ever.
A one gallon tub of ice cream (I was only able to find 1.25 gallons), bananas, cherries, and whipped cream. I went out and found some “better” options not just because I’m a HUGE reeses peanut butter cup fan, but because I wanted a little more variety in this one. 

The sundae consists of..
-1.25 gallons of vanilla ice cream (almost 5.5 POUNDS of ice cream) 
- 4 whole bananas 
- ½ pack of cookie dough 
- reeses Easter eggs 
- pack of Reese's peanut butter cups 
- brownie bites 
- chocolate fudge 
- maraschino cherries 
- whipped cream 


I gave myself 30 minutes to complete this 8 POUND challenge. 
I finished around the 21 mark after a TON of brain freeze and a huge sugar rush. 
This was my first ice cream challenge yet, and by FAR the most enjoyable. 
 


STAY TUNED FOR MORE!

About Erik TheElectric:

I'm Erik. I'm more than just a face on your computer screen, stuffing stupid amounts of food in his mouth.
